raw_text:
X Factor show gets second series
 
 TV talent show The X Factor is to return for a second series after being recommissioned by ITV.
 
 Judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh and Sharon Osbourne are in discussions to sign up for the new series. The final of the first series will take place on 11 December. Last Saturday's show was beaten in the ratings by the BBC's Strictly Come Dancing. "Working on the X Factor has been a blast... I predict series two will be even better," said Cowell. "I think the production team have done an amazing job," he added.
 
 The Pop Idol-style show votes off a group or contestant every week - the two that receive the lowest public vote have to perform a second time before the judges make a final decision. Rowetta Satchell, Steve Brookstein, Tabby Callaghan and group G4 are the remaining finalists. ITV's controller of entertainment, Claudia Rosencrantz, said she had no hesitation in recommissioning the show. "There's much more to come this series as we build towards the final next month and it's great to have secured this terrific format for our viewers for another series," she said.
llama3.2:1b: X Factor returns for second series after being recommitted by ITV, with Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh, and Sharon Osbourne in discussions to sign on for the new series. The first series finale will take place on December 11. The production team have done an "amazing job" according to Cowell, who predicts the show will be even better than before.
llama3.2:3b: The X Factor is set to return for a second series after being recommissioned by ITV, with judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh, and Sharon Osbourne in discussions to participate. The first series finale will take place on December 11, while the show's ratings trailed behind Strictly Come Dancing last week.
gemma2:2b: The X Factor is returning for a second season on ITV. Judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh and Sharon Osbourne are expected to participate. The final of the first season will air December 11th. Viewers voted off contestants in each episode before judges made the final decision.  ITV recommitted to the show, citing its success and potential.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The X Factor return series after ITV commission. Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh and Sharon Osbourne are in discussion on which group or contestant will appear in the new series. The final of the first series was beaten by Strictly Come Dancing and Rowetta Satchell, Steve Brookstein, Tabby Callaghan and group G4. ITV's controller of entertainment Claudia Rosencrantz has no hesitation in recommissioning the X Factor for another series.
qwen2.5:1.5b: The X Factor TV talent show returns with a second series, featuring judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh, and Sharon Osbourne in discussions about signing on for the revival, following its debut defeat by Strictly Come Dancing and promising better results based on previous experiences.
qwen2.5:3b: TV talent show The X Factor is set to return for a second series after being recommissioned by ITV. Judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh, and Sharon Osbourne are in discussions to participate. The final of the first series will occur on December 11th. Cowell predicts that the second series will be even better than the first. The show eliminates groups or contestants weekly based on public votes; Rowetta Satchell, Steve Brookstein, Tabby Callaghan, and group G4 are among the remaining finalists. ITV's Claudia Rosencrantz confirmed her agency’s decision to recommission the show due to its potential for future development leading up to the final next month.
opencoder:1.5b: The X Factor show is scheduled for a second series following a recommission by ITV after a thorough investigation into user ratings, production team performance, and more. The key focus elements are on returning to a series-format rather than an entirely new one. With the final of the first series still on 11 December, the ratings difference between the show and previous competitions have been minimal, indicating a steady increase in viewership. The producers praised for building anticipation and enhancing the format, noting similarities with the BBC's Strictly Come Dancing series. Furthermore, the production team has done an impressive job, showing consistent quality over time. As such, it is expected that series two will continue to attract more viewers, albeit slightly less than initially anticipated.
smollm:1.7b:
The X Factor is a TV talent show that has been on air since 2013, with its second season premiering in 2015. The show features contestants competing in various challenges and performances to win the title of "X Factor" winner. The show was originally broadcast by ITV but was later moved to Channel 4 in 2016.

The judges for the X Factor are Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh, and Sharon Osbourne. They have all been involved in the production of the show since its inception. The final of the first season took place on 11 December last Saturday, beating the BBC's Strictly Come Dancing by a landslide.

The second series of the X Factor is expected to be even better than the first one, with more contestants and challenges. The production team has done an amazing job in preparing for the show, which will feature two finalists every week.

Rowetta Satchell, Steve Brookstein, Tabby Callaghan, and group G4 are the remaining finalists for the second season of the X Factor. ITV's controller of entertainment, Claudia Rosencrantz, said she had no hesitation in recommissioning the show, which is a great sign that the production team has done a good job preparing for the next series.

The second season of the X Factor will feature more contestants competing in various challenges and performances to win the title of "X Factor" winner. The show will also feature new challenges and performances each week, which will keep the competition exciting and engaging for viewers.

<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize the given text into a concise summary without any explanations or formatting. Let me start by reading through the entire text carefully.

The first paragraph talks about X Factor getting a second series and it's coming back after being recommissioned by ITV. It mentions Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh, and Sharon Osbourne are involved in discussions for the new series. The final episode of the first series is on December 11th. The BBC's Strictly Come Dancing had their show lose ratings to X Factor.

In the second paragraph, it describes Pop Idol-style voting with contestants who receive lowest votes have to perform a second time before the judges make a decision. The finalists are Rowetta Satchell, Steve Brookstein, Tabby Callaghan, and group G4. ITV's controller Claudia Rosencrantz is happy about the series being recompensed and building towards the next season.

Now, I need to condense this into a summary that includes key ideas: X Factor returning for a second series, the judges involved, last episode details, competition finale, and the BBC's performance. I should make sure to mention each of these points succinctly without getting bogged down in extra details.
</think>

The X Factor talent show is returning for a second series after being recompmissioned by ITV. Judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh, and Sharon Osbourne are involved in discussions. The final episode of the first season will air on December 11th. Last week's show lost ratings toStrictly Come Dancing on BBC TV. Contestants Rowetta Satchell, Steve Brookstein, Tabby Callaghan, and group G4 compete for finalists, with the lowest vote-getters needing a second performance before judging decisions are made by Cowell. Claudia Rosencrantz is happy about the series recompensation and building towards the next season.
tinyllama:1.1b: X Factor, a popular TV talent show, is set for a second season after being recommissioned by ITV. Judges Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh and Sharon Osbourne are in talks to sign up for the new series, and it was revealed that the final of the first series took place on December 11th. The production team has produced a series two that promises even better ratings than the first season. The show sees contestants perform at each stage of the voting process before being judged by Cowell, Walsh, and Osbourne. Rowetta Satchell, Steve Brookstein, Tabby Callaghan, and G4 are the remaining finalists. ITV's Controller of Entertainment, Claudia Rosencraentz, said she was confident in recommissioning X Factor for a second season, stating that there is much more to come in terms of show production.

According to judges Simon Cowell, "Working on the X Factor has been a blast...I predict the show's second season will be even better." The production team has done an amazing job with the production, and ITV's controller of entertainment, Claudia Rosencrantz, believes there's much more to come.
phi:2.7b: The X Factor, a talent show on ITV, will return for its second series after being recommissioned in 2011. Simon Cowell, Louis Walsh, and Sharon Osbourne are set to be judges once again. The final will take place on 11 December, which is two weeks after the previous season's finale that was beaten by Strictly Come Dancing. In this show, contestants are voted off by the public every week, and the two with the lowest votes have to perform a second time before the judges make their decision. There are now four remaining finalists - Rowetta Satchell, Steve Brookstein, Tabby Callaghan, and group G4. The show's producer has confirmed there will be another season.
